page.title: 06BARNARD CASTLE STREET MARKET
page.content: I have been selling material on Barnard Castle market for 28 years, since I was 16 years old.I also go to Bishop Auckland,Otley and Bedale,so I do a lot of travelling round in my van .My day starts at 6.45am when I put up my stall and set out my goods.In summer this is pleasant,but it can be rough in winter when it is wet,windy or snowing,as I must be careful not to get my material wet or dirty and of course,trade is not good in bad weather.The market is not as busy as it was years ago,perhaps because people have cars and go to larger towns to shop.We take our stalls down again at 4.45pm so it is a long day. You have to have a sense of humour and be friendly in this job or you will not be successful.I like the outdoor life and meeting people.I could not do anything else to earn a living.
